question.text:
Here are two facts about 18th century America:

• On Sunday it was customary to go to Church.
• Sometimes it took a day to ride to a closest town.

Since then much in America changed. However, because of the logic above, what do we still do on a Tuesday?

answer.desc: To ensure that everyone have a chance to vote, U.S. allowed for 1 day to ride to a polling station after attending a church on Sunday.

question.text: Anti-Turkish alliance, which Poland signed in 1683 with Leopold I, was backdated to March 31. Why?

answer.text: Because they did not want to date it April 1st
answer.desc: Conviction about April's Fool's Day was so strong in Poland that they did not want to risk people thinking this alliance was a joke.

question.text: If you know why we blow on a hot cup of tea to cool it off, then you’ll easily answer that the most effective way to blow is not on a tea itself but blow ... how?

answer.desc:
• The way hot liquid cools off is by interacting with much cooler air.

• Heat, which escapes from hot liquid, creates a BUFFER ABOVE THE CUP.

• So we blow to blow away that BUFFER OF HOT AIR ABOVE THE CUP.

question.text:

question.text: In 1840s, in New York, rich establishments hired private gangs to guard their property. There were two main rival gangs: Metropolitans and Municipals. Municipals whore shiny metal badges and Metropolitans did not. What term, widely used today, do we call Municipals now and why?

answer.desc:
Private security gangs developed into Police Officers.

Rival gang of Metropolitans called Municipals "cops" (short from "copper" because they wore copper badges) this is how the name for Police Officers came about.
